title: Cover, ca. 1875
markings: Marks: Painted on unglazed reserve patch on underside of base: "22964" in black. Otherwise unmarked.
creditline: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Norton Spritz
description: Oval, flat-based dish (a). Sides tapered toward lip, molded with swagged nets alternating with game trophies. At edge of base and lip molded ochre-glazed twisted-rope border. Ground glazed brown, with molded motifs picked out in yellow, white, blue, and brown. Interior glazed with bright mauve; underside mottled green and brown. Oval cover (b) glazed mauve on underside. Exterior molded with central finial in form of a fox on fern fronds and a dead duck. Cover in polychrome colors as on base.

tombstone.epitaph:
Cover, ca. 1875.
ca. 1875. earthenware, glaze. Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Norton Spritz. 1991-152-3-a,b.
